column2: Elegant neighborhood that embodies Hollywood's vision of San Francisco, with blocks of Victorian mansions and Cinemascope views of the Bay.

A fashionable and trendy neighborhood with bohemian charm, home of the SFJAZZ Center, historically home of the Ohlone tribe. Back then, Hayes Valley would have been thickly covered with wildflowers every spring. When it was running in the winter, Hayes Creek cut diagonally through the current Hayes Valley. It is now underground year-round.

The Mission gets its name from the Alta California Mission (the sixth church built in California, and the oldest building in San Francisco). The Mission is home to the Roxie, the oldest movie theater in San Francisco.

The Castro was one of the first gay neighborhoods in the United States. Having transformed from a working-class neighborhood through the 1960s and 1970s, the Castro remains one of the most prominent symbols of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) activism and events in the world.
The name Haight Ashbury comes from the crossing of these two streets. This unique and colorful community was home of the 'Summer of Love' in 1967.
San Francisco's "Little Italy." Home to Coit Tower, Washington Square Park, and some of the liveliest nightclubs and bars in town.

Part of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area, the Presidio is a park and former military base on the northern tip of the San Francisco Peninsula, characterized by many wooded areas, hills, and scenic vistas overlooking the Golden Gate Bridge.

South of Market is a huge district, sprawling from the Embarcadero to Eleventh Street, between Market and Townsend. The neighborhood is a patchwork of warehouses, swanky nightspots, residential hotels, art spaces, loft apartments, furniture showrooms and the tenacious Internet companies that survived the tech market collapse.

A dreamy neighborhood on the edge of the bay, the Marina entices shoppers, diners, and picnickers to crowd its boutique-lined streets and hilly green space. Home to Chrissy Field, the Palace of Fine Arts, and Fort Mason, this is the land of SUVs, chic fashion and killer spa treatments.
